title: Congressman Picked for South Carolina Senate Seat
text: The move makes Tim Scott, a Republican, the first black senator from the South since the late 19th century.

title: Good Name Is Restored in Terrain Known for Tea
text: DARJEELING, India — Among connoisseurs, few teas surpass a good Darjeeling. The smooth and mellow taste commands a premium price, and the name itself evokes a bygone era when the British first introduced Chinese tea plants here in the Indian foothills of the Himalayas.

title: When the Family Business Is Wooden Water Tanks
text: Installing, maintaining and replacing them in New York City are tasks largely handled by old family businesses.

title: Massachusetts Fines Investment Bank Over Chumhum
text: The state’s top financial regulator accused the bank of improperly influencing the I.P.O. process.

title: Staten Island Landfill Park Proves Savior in Hurricane
text: During Hurricane Sandy, the Fresh Kills landfill on Staten Island absorbed a critical part of the storm surge. Its hills and waterways spared nearby neighborhoods like Travis, Bulls Head, New Springville and Arden Heights

title: Please, Mom and Dad: Just Have a Taste
text: My childhood tasted of bland roast chicken and canned crescent rolls — starchy fare that typically came out of a box, plopped on our plates by our tireless working mom. Dining out usually meant wielding our trays down the line at Luby’s Cafeteria in San Antonio for mashed potatoes and a factory-cut square of fried fish, with a clover-shaped dinner roll on the side.
